Award.AwardTitle: I-Corps Teams: Duocon - Advanced Wireless Technology
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is significant since the platform is an enabler of a range of high-speed wireless communications for next generation broadband applications. The next generation of the telecommunication network (5G and beyond) is going to be a technological paradigm shift, which is not only an evolution of the network but also the underlying fabric of an entire ecosystem of fully connected intelligent sensors and devices. 5G is an enabler of many applications and will impact virtually every industry sector, ranging from automotive, manufacturing, healthcare to smart city Internet of Things (IoT) and smart homes. Full realization of the economic growth of 5G, however, will depend on how robustly the network is deployed, and will require different approaches from those used in the past. In order to enable the ten-fold increase in data-rate and capacity, 5G network will heavily rely on advanced wireless technologies. The company's technology platform will solve some of the key challenges of wireless radios and networks, and will pave the way towards the rapid roll-out and growth of 5G, in the global race to get to the 5G first.

This I-Corps project aims to enable multi-gigabit wireless communications for the emerging high-speed wireless applications. The core of the company's technology is a high-performance RF front-end, which enables our unique combination of features in our innovative wireless transceiver. The proposed RF front-end is based on novel system-level architectures along with high-performance RF components and sub-systems that are fundamentally different from the existing state-of-the-art fiber-speed wireless modules. To enable realization of the RF front-end, the team is applying a set of innovative design methodologies and technologies to tackle the challenges of the proposed complex RF front-end architectures. The company's RF front-end platform is the core technical contribution and intellectual merit of the approach, which provides the hardware necessary to enable the vision of a truly fiber-speed network with the ultimate network robustness, agility, with significant cost savings for the operators and businesses.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Institution.Name: Regents of the University of Michigan - Ann Arbor
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN

POR.DRECONTENT:
One of the key outcomes of this I-Corps Teams award is that it has led the team to expand its market knowledge in the targeted market segments and better understand the product-market fit, customers' needs,  and the value propositions for its technology in each of the corresponding targeted segments. Moreover, the training has also been very helpful to the team in identifying its beachhead market and go-to-market strategy and approach. This market insight has been essential in understanding the market risks as well as the approaches to mitigate those market and business risks. It has also advanced the team's vision of the technology and informed the technical specifications and features that need to be developed to the required technology features to better address the customers' needs. The team has applied this vision in the technology development process and their roadmap to best address the market needs.

 

In addition to the market and technical knowledge and insights gained through this I-Corps Teams award, the learnings in the program have enabled the team to more effectively explain its market and technology vision and differentiation to multiple stakeholders and secure the resources needed to develop and commercialize its technology. More specifically, this program has been very helpful to the team in securing the follow-on fundings to support continuation of its R&D and commercialization activities, where the team has successfully been awarded several SBIR awards, grants, and fellowships from the most prestigious institutions and agencies, including the NSF. Additionally, the program has also been very helpful to the team in expanding their advisory board (existing and also potential future advisors) for their startup through establishing and building relationships with the market and industry experts and leaders.


Last Modified: 09/01/2020
Modified by: Jonathan Fay
